description: (of a secret or something unknown) come to be known; be revealed

usageExamples.sentence: it transpired that millions of dollars of debt had been hidden in a complex web of transactions

usageExamples.sentence: there was a small crack in the wrist bone

description: The Document Object Model is a cross platform and language independent interface that treats a HTML or XML as a tree structure wherein each node is an object represents a part of the document. The DOM represents a document with a logical tree.
formally declare or promise that something is or will be the case; solemnly undertake to do something; undertake formally to give

usageExamples.sentence: Rings are exchanged by the couple as a pledge of their external love

description:
having a composed and self-assured manner; having a graceful and elegant bearing.
be ready and prepared to do something.

description: likely or liable to suffer from, do or experience something unpleasant or regrettable

usageExamples.sentence: Field screens are prone to damage by pests and pathogens

description: has reached an extreme or unexpected level; outside of the normal range of measurement, beyond expectations

usageExamples.sentence: As a political candidate, he is absolutely off the charts

description: appear as a vague or shadowy form, especially one that is large or threatening

usageExamples.sentence: The government has not woken up to the looming crisis

description: (of a government or other authority) forcibly pass (a measure) by restricting debate or otherwise overriding oppositions

description: A contract by which one party conveys land property or service to another for a specific time, usually in return for a periodic payment

description: Something that is almost impossible to find because it is hidden among so many other things

usageExamples.sentence: Searching for your earring in the park will be like looking for a needle in a haystack

description: A personal who is responsible for a crime or other misdeed

usageExamples.sentence: Low level ozone pollution is the real culprit

description: plausible deniability is the ability of people, typically senior officials in a formal or informal chain of command, to deny knowledge of or responsibility for actions committed by or on behalf of their organisational hierarchy

usageExamples.sentence: There is evidence that Wagner was used as a proxy by the Russian government, allowing the Russian state to have plausible deniability for military operations abroad, and allowing it to hide the true casualties of Russia's foreign interventions

description: based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system

usageExamples.sentence: Our choice was purely arbitrary

description: while someone or something is not present or does not exist

usageExamples.sentence: In the absence of proof, the charge cannot be sustained
